channel.title: Assigned on me (UC Berkeley Information Services and Technology)
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [CMI-241] Dept lookup: Theater Dept missing

description.p: Theater, Dance, and Performance department is missing from the Dept lookup. see screenshot

item.summary: Dept lookup: Theater Dept missing

item.title: [CMI-240] Formats Page: (Web-Based courses) Allow user to opt to attach answers as document

description.p: Below where it says "It looks like you are proposing an online course...", add 2 radio buttons.

radio #1 (default selected): I will answer the questions below
radio #2: I will attach a separate document with the answers to these questions.

If the user leaves #1 selected, then validate that there is text in all 14 questions
If the user select #2, then hide the questions, don't validate that the questions are filled out, and put a reminder on the Attachments page to upload the required Online Course questions

item.summary: Formats Page: (Web-Based courses) Allow user to opt to attach answers as document

item.title: [CMI-235] Proposal Creation > Proposal Summary > Grading > Final Exam > Alternative Method of Assessment

description.p:
I selected Alternative Method of Assessment and entered the data in the required field.
I would have expected to see "Alternative Method of Assessment" with that data in the "Catalog Preview" section; however in the Catalog Preview I do not see that there is not a final exam... If I were a student I would want to know this. Perhaps my expectation as a reviewer from outside of the project is not correct..?

item.summary: Proposal Creation > Proposal Summary > Grading > Final Exam > Alternative Method of Assessment

item.title: [CMI-231] Senate View can see Course Contact Actions

description.p:
Logged in as test-322585 with Senate Staff Rules. I can see "Course Contact Actions"
See screen shot...

item.environment:
Browser: Firefox 4.0
OS: Mac OS 10.6.6
Java Version: Java SE 6 (64-bit/32-bit) version 1.6.0_24-b07-334
item.summary: Senate View can see Course Contact Actions

item.title: [CMI-228] Course Change History

description.p:
Store information about course changes every time a course is:
a) changed without requiring Senate Approval
b) changed when a proposal and Senate Approval is required

Save the following info:
a) the effective date of the change
b) the kind of changes that were made
c) the user who made the change (or proposed the change if it required Senate Approval)
d) what changed: prereqs, etc.

If it is possible to build this information so that it is displayed on another tab in the proposal summary, then that would be cool for now. Eventually we want to display this in the course summary page on Course Search but only for authorized users.

item.summary: Course Change History

item.title: [CMI-227] Withdraw Course: Implement this

description.p: Implement the ability for the user to withdraw a course.

ul.li: Add Withdraw a Course to the "I Want To" options

For the chosen course,
Display the last time the course was offered
Allow user to enter effective date to withdraw the course
Allow user to fill in remarks to Committee
Follow normal workflow where proposal is then sent to Dept Reviewer, etc.

item.summary: Withdraw Course: Implement this

item.summary: Proposal Summary: Change Interaction for "Approved by American Cultures SubCommittee on _______"

item.title: [CMI-224] Proposal Summary: Side-by-Side compare not displaying for Modify Course proposals

description.p: If I choose to modify a course and create a modify course proposal, the changes I am proposing are not viewable as a side-by-side comparison.

item.summary: Proposal Summary: Side-by-Side compare not displaying for Modify Course proposals

item.title: [CMI-223] Proposal Summary (Take Action): Set the COCI Review Date value when proposal status changes to Senate Review

description.p: Use the COCI Committee Meeting dates (taken from here: http://academic-senate.berkeley.edu/meetings/committee) to default populate the COCI Review Date.
Populate this field when proposal status changes to Senate Review, but allow for the Senate Staff to change the date thereafter.

The logic should be as follows:
Compare the proposal submit date to 1 week prior to the next scheduled COCI Meeting date.
If the proposal submit date is before 1 week prior to the next COCI Meeting date, set the "COCI Review Date" to the next COCI meeting date.
If the proposal submit date is after the date that is 1 week prior to the next COCI Meeting date, set the "COCI Review Date" to the next COCI meeting date after the upcoming COCI meeting.

Example:
Today is 3/14/2011.
The next few COCI Meetings are on 3/18/2011, 4/1/2011, 4/15/2011.
One-week prior to the next COCI Meeting is 3/11/2011.
When the proposal status changes to Senate Review, set the Next COCI Review date to 4/1/2011.

item.summary: Proposal Summary (Take Action): Set the COCI Review Date value when proposal status changes to Senate Review

item.title: [CMI-217] CREATE COURSE: General Course Info: – using Tab from Department Field

description.p:
Using "Tab" from "Department" field, causes "Course Number" field to try and load, but does not load.
Leaving Course number empty causes nothing to load and prevents you from doing anything else.

item.summary: CREATE COURSE: General Course Info: – using Tab from Department Field

item.title: [CMI-211] Modify Course: Allow for searching using the Alternate identifiers for a cross-listed course

description.p: using DUTCH C178 as an example, I can search for existing course DUTCH C178, but I will get no results if I try to search for one of its alternate identifiers: AFRICAM C178 and SPANISH C178

item.summary: Modify Course: Allow for searching using the Alternate identifiers for a cross-listed course

item.title: [CMI-208] Remove references to kuali/main/qa (or prod) and use the Kuali standard which is kuali/main/dev

description.p: Make the reference to the XML configuration file consistent with Kuali: That is uniform and not maven -P dependent. Remove /home/xxx/kuali/main/yyy and replace with kuali/main/dev (or ./kuali/main/dev - investigate trying both). To be Kuali compatible, all environments start KS from the Tomcat home directory and all use the "dev" directory.

Each Tomcat instance (or developer user on Windows) on each server has a kuali/main/dev directory under the home directory. It should not matter what the name of the tomcat home directory is and should not be a configuration parameter.
This needs to be fixed in the CMI Manage Proposals project as well.

item.summary: Remove references to kuali/main/qa (or prod) and use the Kuali standard which is kuali/main/dev

item.title: [CMI-204] General Info Page: (modify course) For Cross-Lists, display Admin dept on top

description.p: When modifying a cross-listed course, user should be able to search using any of the cross-listed course's identifiers. (Pretty sure this part works fine.)
When the user indicates that they want to change the course, the General Course Info page should show the Admin cross-list dept on top as the 1st department listed.

item.summary: General Info Page: (modify course) For Cross-Lists, display Admin dept on top

comment.p:
This was not really the issue, I created
CMI-211
instead

item.title: [CMI-203] General Info Page: Refine logic for checking if Cross-listed course number exists

description.p: Using the example of adding cross-list department POL SCI C135
1. If the course entered has a C prefix AND it exists as an unavailable number, then provide a message saying:
"POL SCI C135 already exists and is already cross-listed. Please try another course number."
2. If the course entered has a C prefix AND does not exist, check to see if the course number without the C exists. If the course number without the C exists, display the message:
"POL SCI 135 is an existing course. What would you like to do with the regular (non-cross-listed) version?"
3. If the user entered POL SCI C135 and it does not exist but POL SCI 135 does exist, then only suggest POL SCI C135, not POL SCI CC135.

item.summary: General Info Page: Refine logic for checking if Cross-listed course number exists

item.title: [CMI-202] General Info Page: Refine logic for checking if Cross-listed course number exists

description.p: Using the example of adding cross-list department POL SCI C135
1. If the course entered has a C prefix AND it exists as an unavailable number, then provide a message saying:
"POL SCI C135 already exists and is already cross-listed. Please try another course number."
2. If the course entered has a C prefix AND does not exist, check to see if the course number without the C exists. If the course number without the C exists, display the message:
"POL SCI 135 is an existing course. What would you like to do with the regular (non-cross-listed) version?"
3. If the user entered POL SCI C135 and it does not exist but POL SCI 135 does exist, then only suggest POL SCI C135, not POL SCI CC135.

item.summary: General Info Page: Refine logic for checking if Cross-listed course number exists

comment.p: Green feedback text displays the old course number if I enter in a couse that exists, then enter in a course that doesn't exist, then enter in a 3rd course that exists, the first course that didn't exist is displayed in the green feedback text.

1. Enter in Art Hist 145, you get the msg that it exists
2. enter in Art Hist 148, then msg that it exists goes away
3. enter Art Hist 151, then you will see that Art Hist 145 still shows up in green user feedback text.

item.title: [CMI-201] Manage Proposals Page: Only allow user to modify the latest version of a course

description.p: User should only be able to modify the latest version of an approved course. if the user clicks on a proposal that has been approved, they should be able to view the proposal, but in order to modify the course again, the user should be required to "Search for a Course to Modify" and then they see the latest version of that course, for which they can create a proposal to modify.
We can set up a time to talk/walk through this if it's confusing just reading it.

item.summary: Manage Proposals Page: Only allow user to modify the latest version of a course

item.title: [CMI-200] Manage Proposals Page: Search for Course to Modify should create Modify Course Proposal

description.p: If I search for a course to modify and create a proposal, a "Create Course Proposal" is created. Instead, a "Modify Course Proposal" should be created.

item.summary: Manage Proposals Page: Search for Course to Modify should create Modify Course Proposal

comment.p: Attached a screen shot of where it currently displays "Create Course Proposal" for both Create and Modify course proposals

item.title: [CMI-199] Manage Proposals Page: show only ACTIVE courses in Select Course to Modify dropdown

description.p: I should only be able to select the latest version of an active course when I choose a course to modify.

item.summary: Manage Proposals Page: show only ACTIVE courses in Select Course to Modify dropdown

item.title: [CMI-198] Formats Page: Add Primary Format dropdown

description.p: To the right of the formats listed, show the default primary format - which is Lecture or Seminar – whichever is the right-most format that was selected.
Allow the user to change the format here using a drop down. This is different than the screenshot, but Ivan & I just discussed it.

item.summary: Formats Page: Add Primary Format dropdown

item.title: [CMI-197] Can't create a Modify Course proposal for an Approved course

description.p: I created a proposal for a new course (ARABIC Q107) and took it all the way through the proposal process until it was Approved. Then I clicked "Search for Course to Modify" and was able to choose ARABIC Q107, but when I selected it and was taken to the proposal summary, I was unable to modify it and create a Modify Course proposal.

item.summary: Can't create a Modify Course proposal for an Approved course

comment.p: 1. I can select an approved proposal and form the Manage Proposals screen. This works fine. (See screenshot called ApprovedProposalSelectedFromTaskList)
2. A few things need to be fixed, because some data from the previous proposal is being displayed in the new proposal. (See screenshot called ActiveCourseSelectedForModify)

3. When I make a change to the modify course proposal, I don't see the side-by-side comparison of the earlier (approved) version of IND ENG Q140 compared to the proposed changes that I have made to it in the change course proposal.

item.title: [CMI-196] Proposal Summary: Refine side-by-side comparison

description.p:
Refine the side-by-side comparison on the proposal summary:
1. Add labels to the top of the comparison columns: "Current Version" and "Proposed Version"
2. Display last modified dates of each version (if possible)
3. Switch orientation: show Current Version on the left, Proposed version on the right
4. Place light bluish background behind the Proposed version
5. highlight changes in proposed version, and make background yellow rather than red.
Link below points to same place as the attached screenshot:

a.href: http://kuali.berkeley.edu/cmi-wireframes/Summary.html#OnLoadVariable=grading UserRole=Course%20Contact AppState= AppAction=update ProposalType=modify-reg OriginatingOrg= FormatIsOnline= IsCrossListCourse=no ProposalState= Prev1xInstrApproval= MiniNavLabel=Modify%20Course GradingUnits= GradingUnitsPart=.0 GradingUnitsMax= GradingUnitsPartMax= EffStartTerm= EffStartTermYear= ProposedUnits= UnexOneTime= CSUM=1

item.summary: Proposal Summary: Refine side-by-side comparison

comment.p: OMG this looks super awesome Vanya! Great work. - Sara

item.title: [CMI-192] Proposal Summary: Grading Option section shows no data even though only Final Exam info is missing

description.p:
I selected a proposal in Draft status.
I'm taken to the Proposal Summary, which shows that Grading Option info is missing. (see GradingOptionShowsEverythingMissing screenshot)
But, Units and Grading Method have been selected, and I can see that when I go to the Grading Options page. It's just Final Exam info that is missing. (see GradingOptionPageHasDataFilledOut screenshot)

item.summary: Proposal Summary: Grading Option section shows no data even though only Final Exam info is missing
